item.title: Kamala Harris wants you to know she’s having a Brat summer
item.description:
On Sunday, President Joe Biden shocked the country with his announcement that he would not seek reelection in November. He threw his support behind vice president Kamala Harris. If elected, Harris would be the first Black and Asian American woman to become president, and her historic run is already creating excitement. Most Democrats are quickly falling in line. Some would say Harris is having a Brat summer.

“Brat summer” is a phrase that’s become the defining pop culture meme of the season — at least for the very online set — and references an album released in June by pop artist Charli XCX titled Brat. Charli XCX is a 31-year-old English woman who’s been around for a while, though her influence is greater than her name recognition....

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Mia Sato

item.title: Senator Bob Menendez to quit after bribery conviction
item.description: Democrat had resisted calls to resign for accepting gifts, including gold bars, to aid foreign states.

item.title: Kamala Harris races towards 2024 nomination after whirlwind start
item.description:
Vice-president wins backing of party leaders Hakeem Jeffries and Chuck Schumer after raising $100m in 24 hours

  • US election – live updates

Kamala Harris won key backing from the Democratic party’s senior congressional leadership on Tuesday as she carried the energy and momentum from her whirlwind ascent to presumptive presidential nominee into a lively first campaign rally.

Chuck Schumer, the Senate majority leader, and House minority leader Hakeem Jeffries, gave the vice-president their endorsement during a lunchtime press briefing. Harris, they said, had re-energized Democrats following Joe Biden’s announcement Sunday that he would no longer seek a second term.

Continue reading...
